alert.note: Alert for Mayes; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Rogers; Wagoner; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 02 at 7:42PM CDT until May 02 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Western Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... South central Washington County in northeastern Oklahoma... Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 742 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles southeast of Vera to 5 miles south of Catoosa to 4 miles south of Bixby, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Broken Arrow... Muskogee... Claremore... Wagoner... Pryor... Owasso... Coweta... Pryor Creek... Catoosa... Verdigris... Chouteau... Haskell... Chelsea... Inola... Oologah... Adair... Okay... Porter... Oktaha... Foyil... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 233 and 270. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Mayes; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Rogers; Wagoner; Washington
